   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(gen_tcp_socket_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -compile([export_all, nowarn_export_all]).
   24: 
   25: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct_event.hrl").
   26: 
   27: all() ->
   28:     [{group, smoketest}].
   29: 
   30: groups() ->
   31:     [{smoketest,    [{group,small}]},
   32:      {benchmark,    [{group,small}, {group,medium},
   33:                      {group,large}, {group,huge}]},
   34:      %%
   35:      {dev,          [{group,dev_direct},
   36:                      {group,dev_inet}, {group,dev_socket}]},
   37:      {dev_inet,     testcases(dev)},
   38:      {dev_socket,   testcases(dev)},
   39:      {dev_direct,   testcases(direct)},
   40:      %%
   41:      {small,        backend_groups()},
   42:      {medium,       backend_groups()},
   43:      {large,        backend_groups()},
   44:      {huge,         backend_groups()},
   45:      %%
   46:      {inet,         testcases(active)},
   47:      {socket,       testcases(active)},
   48:      {direct,       testcases(direct)}].
   49: 
   50: backend_groups() ->
   51:     [{group,inet}, {group,socket}, {group,direct}].
   52: 
   53: testcases(active) ->
   54:     [active_raw, active_false, active_true,
   55:      active_once, active_1, active_5, active_20];
   56: testcases(dev) ->
   57:     [active_raw, active_false, active_true,
   58:      active_once, active_20];
   59: testcases(direct) ->
   60:     [socket_raw, socket_packet, socket_packet_buf, socket_packet_cheat].
   61: 
   62: -define(SUITE, "gen_tcp_socket").
   63: -define(DOMAIN, inet).
   64: %% *_EXP is a power of 2 exponent so the resulting value is
   65: %% 1 bsl ?*_EXP
   66: -define(NORM_EXP, 30). % Total byte size norm: packet size * number of packets
   67: -define(BUFSIZE_EXP, 17).
   68: -define(BUFSIZE, (1 bsl ?BUFSIZE_EXP)).
   69: 
   70: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   71:     case socket:is_supported(protocols, tcp) of
   72:         true ->
   73:             ct:pal("socket:info():~n    ~p~n", [socket:info()]),
   74:             {ok, BindAddr} = kernel_test_lib:which_local_addr(?DOMAIN),
   75:             [{bind_addr, #{ family => ?DOMAIN, addr   => BindAddr }}
   76:             | Config];
   77:         false ->
   78:             {skip, "Socket not supported"}
   79:     end.
   80: 
   81: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   82:     ct:pal("socket:info():~n    ~p~n", [socket:info()]),
   83:     ok.
   84: 
   85: 
   86: init_per_group(Nm, Config) ->
   87:     case Nm of
   88:         smoketest   -> [{burden,0} | Config];
   89:         benchmark   -> [{burden,2} | Config]; % 4 times the total size
   90:         %%
   91:         dev         -> init_per_group(dev_size, [{burden,3} | Config]);
   92:         dev_inet    -> init_per_group(inet,     Config);
   93:         dev_socket  -> init_per_group(socket,   Config);
   94:         dev_direct  -> init_per_group(direct,   Config);
   95:         %%
   96:         dev_size    ->
   97:             init_per_group_size(
   98:               ?BUFSIZE_EXP + 4, ?NORM_EXP - (?BUFSIZE_EXP + 4), Config);
   99:         %% For small packets we cannot have the total size 2^?NORM_EXP
  100:         %% since the message passing overhead (latency) starts to dominate
  101:         %% so we have to subtract some from the exponent to get
  102:         %% roughly the same running time
  103:         small       -> init_per_group_size(7, ?NORM_EXP - 7 - 3, Config);
  104:         medium      -> init_per_group_size(10, ?NORM_EXP - 10 - 1, Config);
  105:         large       -> init_per_group_size(15, ?NORM_EXP - 15, Config);
  106:         huge ->
  107:             init_per_group_size(
  108:               ?BUFSIZE_EXP + 2, ?NORM_EXP - (?BUFSIZE_EXP + 2), Config);
  109:         %%
  110:         _ when Nm =:= inet;
  111:                Nm =:= socket;
  112:                Nm =:= direct -> [{backend,Nm} | Config]
  113:     end.
  114: 
  115: init_per_group_size(K, L, Config) ->
  116:     {_, Burden} = proplists:lookup(burden, Config),
  117:     M = L + Burden,
  118:     N = 1 bsl M,
  119:     %% 2^K     = Mean packet size
  120:     %% 2^(K+1) = Max packet size
  121:     %% N       = Number of packets;
  122:     StopTag = spawn_testdata_server(K+1, N),
  123:      %%
  124:     {MeanSize, SizeSuffix} = size_and_suffix(1 bsl K),
  125:     {PacketCount, CountSuffix} = size_and_suffix(N),
  126:     ct:pal("Packet mean size: ~w ~sByte, packet count: ~w ~s",
  127:            [MeanSize, SizeSuffix, PacketCount, CountSuffix]),
  128:     %%
  129:     [{testdata_server, StopTag},
  130:      {testdata_size,   {K, M}} | Config].
  131: 
  132: end_per_group(Nm, Config) ->
  133:     case Nm of
  134:         dev -> proplists:delete(burden, end_per_group(dev_size, Config));
  135:         dev_inet    -> end_per_group(inet, Config);
  136:         dev_socket  -> end_per_group(socket, Config);
  137:         dev_direct  -> end_per_group(direct, Config);
  138:         _ when Nm =:= smoketest;
  139:                Nm =:= dev;
  140:                Nm =:= benchmark -> proplists:delete(burden, Config);
  141:         _ when Nm =:= dev_size;
  142:                Nm =:= small;
  143:                Nm =:= medium;
  144:                Nm =:= large;
  145:                Nm =:= huge ->
  146:             {_, StopTag} = proplists:lookup(testdata_server, Config),
  147:             stop_testdata_server(StopTag),
  148:             proplists:delete(
  149:               testdata_server, proplists:delete(testdata_size, Config));
  150:         _ when Nm =:= inet;
  151:                Nm =:= socket;
  152:                Nm =:= direct -> proplists:delete(backend, Config)
  153:     end.
  154: 
  155: 
  156: size_and_suffix(P) ->
  157:     size_and_suffix(P, 1, ["", "K", "M", "T", "Z"]).
  158: %%
  159: size_and_suffix(P, _, []) ->
  160:     {P, ""};
  161: size_and_suffix(P, Q, Suffixes) ->
  162:     Q_1 = Q bsl 10,
  163:     if
  164:         is_integer(P), Q_1 =< P, P band (Q_1 - 1) =:= 0 ->
  165:             size_and_suffix(P, Q_1, tl(Suffixes));
  166:         Q bsl 13 =< P ->
  167:             size_and_suffix(P, Q_1, tl(Suffixes));
  168:         true ->
  169:             {round(P / Q), hd(Suffixes)}
  170:     end.
  171: 
  172: %% -------
  173: %% Testcases
  174: 
  175: -define(
  176:    XFER(Name),
  177:    Name(Config) -> xfer(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME)).
  178: 
  179: ?XFER(active_raw).
  180: ?XFER(active_false).
  181: ?XFER(active_true).
  182: ?XFER(active_once).
  183: ?XFER(active_1).
  184: ?XFER(active_5).
  185: ?XFER(active_20).
  186: ?XFER(socket_raw).
  187: ?XFER(socket_packet).
  188: ?XFER(socket_packet_buf).
  189: ?XFER(socket_packet_cheat).
  190: 
  191: %% -------
  192: 
  193: tc2active(TC) ->
  194:     case TC of
  195:         active_raw      -> raw;
  196:         active_false    -> false;
  197:         active_true     -> true;
  198:         active_once     -> once;
  199:         active_1        -> 1;
  200:         active_5        -> 5;
  201:         active_20       -> 20
  202:     end.
  203: 
  204: xfer(Config, TC) when is_list(Config) ->
  205:     {_, Backend}      = proplists:lookup(backend,       Config),
  206:     {_, BindAddr}     = proplists:lookup(bind_addr,     Config),
  207:     {_, TestdataSize} = proplists:lookup(testdata_size, Config),
  208:     run_xfer(TC, Backend, BindAddr, TestdataSize,  testdata()).
  209: 
  210: run_xfer(
  211:   TC, Backend, BindAddr, {K, _} = TestdataSize,
  212:   #{iovecs       := Iovecs,
  213:     packet_sizes := PacketSizes,
  214:     total_size   := TotalSize}) ->
  215:     %%
  216:     Parent = self(),
  217:     Tag = make_ref(),
  218:     {Sender, Mref} =
  219:         spawn_opt(
  220:           fun () ->
  221:                   try
  222:                       %% Send iovecs efficiently
  223:                       {ok, L} =
  224:                           gen_tcp:listen(
  225:                             0, [{ifaddr,BindAddr}, {sndbuf, 2 bsl K}]),
  226:                       {ok, {IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
  227:                       Sockaddr =
  228:                           #{family => inet, addr => IP, port => Port},
  229:                       Parent ! {Tag, Sockaddr},
  230:                       {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
  231:                       ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
  232:                       send_loop(A, Iovecs),
  233:                       ok = gen_tcp:close(A)
  234:                   catch Class : Reason : Stacktrace ->
  235:                           ct:pal(
  236:                             "Sender crash [~w] ~w : ~p~n    ~p~n",
  237:                             [self(), Class, Reason, Stacktrace]),
  238:                           erlang:raise(Class, Reason, Stacktrace)
  239:                   end
  240:           end, [monitor]),
  241:     receive
  242:         {Tag, Sockaddr} ->
  243:             {ok, C} = connect(Backend, Sockaddr, TC),
  244:             try
  245:                 T1 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  246:                 assert({ok, TotalSize}, recv_loop(C, PacketSizes, TC)),
  247:                 T2 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  248:                 T = erlang:convert_time_unit(T2 - T1, native, millisecond),
  249:                 report_MByte_s(Backend, TestdataSize, TC, TotalSize, T)
  250:             catch Class : Reason : Stacktrace ->
  251:                     ct:pal(
  252:                       "Receiver crash [~w] ~w : ~p~n    ~p~n",
  253:                       [self(), Class, Reason, Stacktrace]),
  254:                     exit(Sender, receiver_crash),
  255:                     %% spawn_link of Sender does not work since
  256:                     %% ct catches the below failure so this process
  257:                     %% doesn't die and the link doesn't trigger,
  258:                     %% therefore the explicit exit/2 above
  259:                     %%
  260:                     erlang:raise(Class, Reason, Stacktrace)
  261:             after
  262:                 close(Backend, C),
  263:                 receive {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,_} -> ok end
  264:             end;
  265:         {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,Reason} ->
  266:             error({sender_died,Reason})
  267:     end.
  268: 
  269: send_loop(_S, []) ->
  270:     ok;
  271: send_loop(S, [Iovec | Iovecs]) ->
  272:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S, Iovec),
  273:     send_loop(S, Iovecs).
  274: 
  275: 
  276: connect(direct, Sockaddr, _) ->
  277:     {ok, S} = socket:open(?DOMAIN, stream),
  278:     ok = socket:bind(S, any),
  279:     ok = socket:setopt(S, {socket,rcvbuf}, ?BUFSIZE),
  280:     ok = socket:setopt(S, {otp,rcvbuf},    ?BUFSIZE),
  281:     io:format("socket:connect [~p].~n", [Sockaddr]),
  282:     case socket:connect(S, Sockaddr) of
  283:         ok ->
  284:             {ok, S};
  285:         Error ->
  286:             Error
  287:     end;
  288: connect(Backend, Sockaddr, active_raw) -> % {active,true}, {packet,raw}
  289:     Opts =
  290:         [{inet_backend,Backend}, binary, {active,true},
  291:          ?DOMAIN, {recbuf,?BUFSIZE}],
  292:     io:format("gen_tcp:connect(~p, ~p).~n", [Sockaddr, Opts]),
  293:     gen_tcp:connect(Sockaddr, Opts);
  294: connect(Backend, Sockaddr, TC) ->
  295:     Opts =
  296:         [{inet_backend,Backend}, binary, {active,tc2active(TC)}, {packet,4},
  297:          ?DOMAIN, {recbuf,?BUFSIZE}],
  298:     io:format("gen_tcp:connect(~p, ~p).~n", [Sockaddr, Opts]),
  299:     gen_tcp:connect(Sockaddr, Opts).
  300: 
  301: 
  302: close(direct, S) ->
  303:     socket:close(S);
  304: close(_, S) ->
  305:     gen_tcp:close(S).
  306: 
  307: 
  308: report_MByte_s(Backend, {K, M}, TC, Size, Time) ->
  309:     ct:log("Size: ~w. Time: ~w.", [Size, Time]),
  310:     Name = io_lib:format("~w 2^(~w+~w)-~w", [Backend, K, M, TC]),
  311:     {Value, Suffix} = size_and_suffix(Size * 1000 / Time),
  312:     report(Name, Value, Suffix++"Byte/s").
  313: 
  314: 
  315: spawn_testdata_server(K, N) ->
  316:     Spawner   = self(),
  317:     Tag       = make_ref(),
  318:     {_, Mref} =
  319:         spawn_opt(
  320:           fun () ->
  321:                   register(?MODULE, self()),
  322:                   Testdata = generate_testdata(K, N),
  323:                   Spawner ! Tag,
  324:                   testdata_server(Tag, Testdata)
  325:           end, [monitor]),
  326:     receive
  327:         Tag ->
  328:             demonitor(Mref, [flush]),
  329:             Tag;
  330:         {'DOWN', Mref, _, _, Info} ->
  331:             error(Info)
  332:     end.
  333: 
  334: testdata_server(Tag, Testdata) ->
  335:     receive
  336:         {get, From} ->
  337:             From ! {From, Testdata},
  338:             testdata_server(Tag, Testdata);
  339:         Tag ->
  340:             ok
  341:     end.
  342: 
  343: stop_testdata_server(Tag) when is_reference(Tag) ->
  344:     case whereis(?MODULE) of
  345:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
  346:             Ref = monitor(process, Pid),
  347:             Pid ! Tag,
  348:             receive {'DOWN', Ref, _, _, _} -> ok end
  349:     end.
  350: 
  351: testdata() ->
  352:     case whereis(?MODULE) of
  353:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
  354:             Ref = monitor(process, ?MODULE, [{alias,reply_demonitor}]),
  355:             Pid ! {get, Ref},
  356:             receive
  357:                 {Ref, Testdata} ->
  358:                     Testdata;
  359:                 {'DOWN', Ref, _, _, Info} ->
  360:                     error(Info)
  361:             end
  362:     end.
  363: 
  364: generate_testdata(K, N) ->
  365:     %% 2^K = Max packet size
  366:     %% N   = Number of packets
  367:     %%
  368:     Offsets        =  generate_offsets(K, N),
  369:     DataBlock      =  create_data_block(1 bsl K),
  370:     Iovecs         =  generate_iovecs(Offsets, DataBlock, 1000),
  371:     DataBlockSize  =  byte_size(DataBlock),
  372:     PacketSizes    =  packet_sizes(Offsets, DataBlockSize),
  373:     TotalSize      =  total_size(Offsets, DataBlockSize),
  374:     #{iovecs       => Iovecs,
  375:       packet_sizes => PacketSizes,
  376:       total_size   => TotalSize}.
  377: 
  378: 
  379: packet_sizes(Offsets, DataBlockSize) ->
  380:     [DataBlockSize - Offset - 4 || Offset <- Offsets].
  381: 
  382: total_size([], _DataBlockSize) -> 0;
  383: total_size([Offset | Offsets], DataBlockSize) ->
  384:     DataBlockSize - Offset + total_size(Offsets, DataBlockSize).
  385: 
  386: generate_iovecs([], _DataBlock, _ChunkSize) -> [];
  387: generate_iovecs(Offsets, DataBlock, ChunkSize) ->
  388:     {Offsets_1, Iovecs} = generate_iovec(Offsets, DataBlock, ChunkSize),
  389:     [Iovecs | generate_iovecs(Offsets_1, DataBlock, ChunkSize)].
  390: 
  391: generate_iovec(Offsets, DataBlock, N) ->
  392:     generate_iovec(Offsets, DataBlock, N, []).
  393: %%
  394: generate_iovec(Offsets, _DataBlock, N, Acc)
  395:   when N =:= 0;
  396:        Offsets =:= [], is_integer(N), 0 < N ->
  397:     {Offsets, lists:reverse(Acc)};
  398: generate_iovec([Offset | Offsets], DataBlock, N, Acc)
  399:   when is_integer(N), 0 < N ->
  400:     <<_:Offset/binary, Bin/binary>> = DataBlock,
  401:     generate_iovec(Offsets, DataBlock, N - 1, [Bin | Acc]).
  402: 
  403: %% 0 =< Offset < 2^K - 1
  404: %% Offset mod 4 == 0
  405: generate_offsets(K, N) when is_integer(K), 6 =< K ->
  406:     %% 3 here corresponds to the 8 iterations below,
  407:     %% and 2 corresponds to the bsl 2 that makes mod 4 == 0
  408:     Range = 1 bsl (K - (3 + 2)),
  409:     generate_offsets(Range, N, []).
  410: %%
  411: generate_offsets(_Range, 0, Offsets) ->
  412:     Offsets;
  413: generate_offsets(Range, N, Offsets) when is_integer(N), 0 < N ->
  414:     Offset = (rand_sum(Range, 8) - 8) bsl 2,
  415:     generate_offsets(Range, N - 1, [Offset | Offsets]).
  416: 
  417: %% Sum I number of rand:uniform values range N
  418: %%
  419: rand_sum(_, 0) -> 0;
  420: rand_sum(N, I) -> rand:uniform(N) + rand_sum(N, I - 1).
  421: 
  422: %% Create a data block that at every offset mod 4 == 0
  423: %% contains that number of bytes after, so at every
  424: %% such offset up to the end of the data block
  425: %% there is a valid packet 4 chunk
  426: %%
  427: create_data_block(M) -> create_data_block(M, <<>>).
  428: %%
  429: create_data_block(M, Bin) when is_integer(M), 4 =< M ->
  430:     %% M   :: Desired chunk size
  431:     %% Bin :: Accumulator, grows at the end
  432:     create_data_block(M - 4, <<Bin/binary, M:32>>);
  433: create_data_block(3 = M, Bin) -> <<Bin/binary, M:32, 3, 2, 1>>;
  434: create_data_block(2 = M, Bin) -> <<Bin/binary, M:32, 2, 1>>;
  435: create_data_block(1 = M, Bin) -> <<Bin/binary, M:32, 1>>;
  436: create_data_block(0 = M, Bin) -> <<Bin/binary, M:32>>.
  437: 
  438: 
  439: %% Receive all packets on the stream, return the total payload size
  440: %%
  441: recv_loop(S, Sizes, TC) ->
  442:     case TC of
  443:         socket_raw ->
  444:             Recv = fun (Socket) -> socket:recv(Socket, 0) end,
  445:             recv_loop_raw(S, 0, Recv);
  446:         socket_packet ->
  447:             recv_loop_packet(S, Sizes, 0, fun socket:recv/2);
  448:         socket_packet_buf ->
  449:             recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, 0, fun socket:recv/2);
  450:         socket_packet_cheat ->
  451:             recv_loop_packet_cheat(S, Sizes, 0, fun socket:recv/2);
  452:         active_raw ->
  453:             recv_loop_active_raw(S, 0);
  454:         active_false ->
  455:             Recv = fun (Socket) -> gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0) end,
  456:             recv_loop_active_false(S, Sizes, 0, Recv);
  457:         active_true ->
  458:             recv_loop_active_true(S, Sizes, 0);
  459:         active_once ->
  460:             recv_loop_active_once(S, Sizes, 0);
  461:         _ ->
  462:             recv_loop_active_n(S, Sizes, 0, tc2active(TC))
  463:     end.
  464: 
  465: %% -------
  466: %% These ignore packet borders and just count the total number of bytes
  467: 
  468: recv_loop_active_raw(S, M) ->
  469:     receive
  470:         {tcp, S, Data} ->
  471:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  472:             recv_loop_active_raw(S, M + DataSize);
  473:         {tcp_closed, S} ->
  474:             {ok, M};
  475:         {tcp_error, S, Reason} ->
  476:             {error, Reason}
  477:     end.
  478: 
  479: recv_loop_raw(S, M, Recv) ->
  480:     case Recv(S) of
  481:         {ok, Data} ->
  482:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  483:             recv_loop_raw(S, M + DataSize, Recv);
  484:         {error, closed} ->
  485:             {ok, M};
  486:         {error, _} = Error ->
  487:             Error
  488:     end.
  489: 
  490: %% -------
  491: %% These implement {packet,4}
  492: 
  493: %% Read packet header then packet body with separate Recv calls
  494: %%
  495: recv_loop_packet(_S, [], M, _Recv) ->
  496:     {ok, M};
  497: recv_loop_packet(S, [Size|Sizes], M, Recv) ->
  498:     case Recv(S, 4) of
  499:         {ok, <<Size:32>>} ->
  500:             case Recv(S, Size) of
  501:                 {ok, Bin} when is_binary(Bin) ->
  502:                     recv_loop_packet(S, Sizes, M + 4 + Size, Recv);
  503:                 Err2 ->
  504:                     Err2
  505:             end;
  506:         Err1 ->
  507:             Err1
  508:     end.
  509: 
  510: %% Use Recv(0) and then parse the received binary into packets.
  511: %%
  512: recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, M, Recv) ->
  513:     case Recv(S, 0) of
  514:         {ok, Data} when 0 < byte_size(Data) ->
  515:             recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, M, Recv, Data);
  516:         {error, closed} ->
  517:             [] = Sizes,
  518:             {ok, M};
  519:         {error, _} = Error ->
  520:             Error
  521:     end.
  522: %%
  523: recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, M, Recv, Buf) ->
  524:     %% Buf is a binary(), no fancy queue
  525:     %%
  526:     case Buf of
  527:         <<PacketSize:32, _:PacketSize/binary, Rest/binary>> ->
  528:             assert(PacketSize, hd(Sizes)),
  529:             NewM = M + 4 + PacketSize,
  530:             recv_loop_packet_buf(S, tl(Sizes), NewM, Recv, Rest);
  531:         <<PacketSize:32, Start/binary>> ->
  532:             %% Partial packet.
  533:             %% Keep it simple and read the rest of the packet with Recv(N).
  534:             %% We could also Recv(0) to get more data but that
  535:             %% would complicate handling of Start + Rest.
  536:             %% This is hopefully a rare case for small packets
  537:             %% and a small overhead for large packets..
  538:             RestSize = PacketSize - byte_size(Start),
  539:             case Recv(S, RestSize) of
  540:                 {ok, Rest} when byte_size(Rest) =:= RestSize->
  541:                     Packet = <<Start/binary, Rest/binary>>,
  542:                     assert(PacketSize, byte_size(Packet)),
  543:                     NewM = M + 4 + PacketSize,
  544:                     assert(PacketSize, hd(Sizes)),
  545:                     recv_loop_packet_buf(S, tl(Sizes), NewM, Recv);
  546:                 {error, _} = Error ->
  547:                     Error
  548:             end;
  549:         <<>> ->
  550:             recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, M, Recv);
  551:         <<Head/binary>> ->
  552:             %% Partial header.
  553:             %% Keep it simple and just Recv(N) the rest of the header.
  554:             %% Using Recv(0) would complicate the code greatly.
  555:             %% This is hopefully a rare case for small packets
  556:             %% and a small overhead for large packets..
  557:             RestSize = 4 - byte_size(Head),
  558:             case Recv(S, RestSize) of
  559:                 {ok, Rest} when byte_size(Rest) =:= RestSize->
  560:                     Data = <<Head/binary, Rest/binary>>,
  561:                     recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, M, Recv, Data);
  562:                 {error, _} = Error ->
  563:                     Error
  564:             end
  565:     end.
  566: 
  567: %% Cheating - we know the next packet size and receive exactly
  568: %% that in one Recv call, and verify the packet header
  569: %%
  570: recv_loop_packet_cheat(_S, [], M, _Recv) ->
  571:     {ok, M};
  572: recv_loop_packet_cheat(S, [Size|Sizes], M, Recv) ->
  573:     case Recv(S, 4 + Size) of
  574:         {ok, <<Size:32, _:Size/binary>>} ->
  575:             recv_loop_packet_cheat(S, Sizes, M + 4 + Size, Recv);
  576:         {ok, Data} ->
  577:             {error,{bad_packet,Data,Size}};
  578:         Err1 ->
  579:             Err1
  580:     end.
  581: 
  582: %% -------
  583: %% These assume that the socket is in {packet,4} mode
  584: 
  585: recv_loop_active_false(S, Sizes, M, Recv) ->
  586:     case Recv(S) of
  587:         {ok, Data} ->
  588:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  589:             assert(DataSize, hd(Sizes)),
  590:             recv_loop_active_false(S, tl(Sizes), M + DataSize + 4, Recv);
  591:         {error, closed} ->
  592:             [] = Sizes,
  593:             {ok, M};
  594:         {error, _} = Error ->
  595:             Error
  596:     end.
  597: 
  598: recv_loop_active_true(S, Sizes, M) ->
  599:     receive
  600:         {tcp, S, Data} ->
  601:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  602:             assert(DataSize, hd(Sizes)),
  603:             recv_loop_active_true(S, tl(Sizes), M + DataSize + 4);
  604:         {tcp_closed, S} ->
  605:             Sizes = [],
  606:             {ok, M};
  607:         {tcp_error, S, Reason} ->
  608:             {error, Reason}
  609:     end.
  610: 
  611: recv_loop_active_once(S, Sizes, M) ->
  612:     receive
  613:         {tcp, S, Data} ->
  614:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  615:             assert(DataSize, hd(Sizes)),
  616:             ok = inet:setopts(S, [{active,once}]),
  617:             recv_loop_active_once(S, tl(Sizes), M + DataSize + 4);
  618:         {tcp_closed, S} ->
  619:             Sizes = [],
  620:             {ok, M};
  621:         {tcp_error, S, Reason} ->
  622:             {error, Reason}
  623:     end.
  624: 
  625: recv_loop_active_n(S, Sizes, M, N) ->
  626:     receive
  627:         {tcp, S, Data} ->
  628:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  629:             assert(DataSize, hd(Sizes)),
  630:             recv_loop_active_n(S, tl(Sizes), M + DataSize + 4, N);
  631:         {tcp_passive, S} ->
  632:             ok = inet:setopts(S, [{active,N}]),
  633:             recv_loop_active_n(S, Sizes, M, N);
  634:         {tcp_closed, S} ->
  635:             Sizes = [],
  636:             {ok, M};
  637:         {tcp_error, S, Reason} ->
  638:             {error, Reason}
  639:     end.
  640: 
  641: %% -------
  642: 
  643: report(Name, Value, Suffix) ->
  644:     ct:pal("### ~s: ~w ~s", [Name, Value, Suffix]),
  645:     ct_event:notify(
  646:       #event{
  647:          name = benchmark_data,
  648:          data = [{value, Value}, {suite, ?SUITE}, {name, Name}]}),
  649:     {comment, term_to_string(Value) ++ " " ++ Suffix}.
  650: 
  651: term_to_string(Term) ->
  652:     unicode:characters_to_list(io_lib:write(Term, [{encoding, unicode}])).
  653: 
  654: -compile({inline, [assert/2]}).
  655: assert(X, X) -> ok;
  656: assert(X, Y) -> error({assert, X, Y}).
